functions.name: httpGet
functions.signature: httpGet(url, connectTimeout=10000, readTimeout=60000, username=None, password=None, headerValues=None, bypassCertValidation=False, useCaches=True, throwOnError=True)

params.name: headerValues
params.description: Custom HTTP header key-value pairs to include in the request

params.name: bypassCertValidation
params.description: If True, bypasses SSL certificate validation for HTTPS

params.name: throwOnError
params.description: If True, throws an exception on HTTP error status codes

returns.description: The response body as a string

functions.description: Retrieves the document at the given URL using HTTP GET and returns it as a string.
functions.long_description: Performs an HTTP GET request to the given URL and returns the response body as a string. Supports Basic authentication, custom headers, SSL bypass, and caching. For more flexible HTTP interactions, consider using system.net.httpClient() instead.

functions.name: httpPost
functions.signature: httpPost(url, postData, contentType='application/x-www-form-urlencoded', connectTimeout=10000, readTimeout=60000, username=None, password=None, headerValues=None, bypassCertValidation=False)

params.name: postData
params.description: The data to post. If a dictionary, entries are URL-encoded. If a string, posted as-is with the given contentType

params.name: contentType
params.description: The MIME type of the post data

params.name: bypassCertValidation
params.description: If True, bypasses SSL certificate validation for HTTPS

returns.description: The response body as a string

functions.description: Sends an HTTP POST request to the given URL and returns the response as a string.
functions.long_description: Performs an HTTP POST to the given URL. If postData is a dictionary, entries are encoded as application/x-www-form-urlencoded. Arbitrary data can be posted by providing a string and the appropriate contentType (e.g., 'application/json').
examples:
import system.util
jsonData = system.util.jsonEncode({'name': 'test'})
response = system.net.httpPost('https://api.example.com/data', jsonData, 'application/json')

functions.name: httpClient
functions.signature: httpClient(timeout=60000, bypass_cert_validation=True, username=None, password=None, proxy=None, cookie_policy=None, redirect_policy=None, version=None)

params.name: timeout
params.description: Read timeout for requests in milliseconds

params.name: bypass_cert_validation
params.description: If True, bypasses SSL certificate validation for HTTPS

params.name: username
params.description: Username for HTTP Basic authentication on all requests

params.name: password
params.description: Password for HTTP Basic authentication on all requests

returns.description: A reusable HTTP client object with get(), post(), put(), delete(), request() methods

functions.description: Creates a reusable HTTP client for sending and receiving HTTP requests. Wraps Java's HttpClient.
functions.long_description: Creates a JythonHttpClient object that can send HTTP requests using get(), post(), put(), delete(), and request() methods. The client is heavyweight and should be created sparingly â€” instantiate once and reuse, ideally as a top-level variable in a project library script. Preferred over httpGet/httpPost for modern Ignition development.
examples:
client = system.net.httpClient(timeout=30000, bypass_cert_validation=False)
response = client.post('https://api.example.com/data', data={'key': 'value'})
print response.getStatusCode()

functions.name: openURL

params.name: url
params.description: The URL or URI scheme to open in the host OS default application

functions.description: Opens the given URL or URI scheme in the host OS default application.
functions.long_description: Opens the given URL or URI scheme outside of the currently running Client in whatever application the host operating system deems appropriate. For example, a web URL opens in the default browser, a mailto: URI opens the default email client.

functions.name: sendEmail
functions.signature: sendEmail(smtp='', fromAddr='', subject='', body='', html=False, to=[], attachmentNames=None, attachmentData=None, timeout=300000, username=None, password=None, priority='3', smtpProfile=None, cc=None, bcc=None, retries=0, replyTo=None)

params.name: smtp
params.description: SMTP server address (host or host:port). Not needed if using smtpProfile

params.name: body
params.description: Email body content (plain text or HTML)

params.name: html
params.description: If True, body is sent as HTML; if False, as plain text

params.name: attachmentData
params.description: List of byte arrays for attachment content

params.name: smtpProfile
params.description: Name of a configured SMTP email profile on the Gateway

params.name: cc
params.description: List of CC recipient email addresses

params.name: bcc
params.description: List of BCC recipient email addresses

params.name: retries
params.description: Number of retry attempts if sending fails

functions.description: Sends an email through the given SMTP server or SMTP profile.
functions.long_description: Sends an email using either a direct SMTP server address or a pre-configured SMTP profile. Supports HTML content, file attachments, CC/BCC recipients, and authentication. When using smtpProfile, the smtp parameter can be omitted.
examples: system.net.sendEmail(smtpProfile='CorporateMail', fromAddr='ignition@example.com', subject='Alarm Alert', body='Tank level is high!', to=['operator@example.com'])
